commitResults.messageTitle: Added Duke's Greeting, Echo and Exit
Completes and closes #2 with Duke's list and add function
Added and implemented Task class to Duke
Added Deadline, Event and ToDo classes
Implemented ToDo, Deadline, Event into Duke
Implemented Todo, Deadline, Event into Duke
Closes #4 and cleaned up command scanning

commitResults.messageBody:
Errors in user input are not caught and runtime exceptions are thrown.

This not only causes Duke to exit ungracefully but also causes the
unsmooth operation of duke.

Thus, I create a DukeException class, extending the Exception
class, which can be thrown with an error message.

Having our own checked exception allows our own exception to be thrown,
caught and then handled to tell the user what was wrong.

This is also done to conform to Level-5
https://nus-cs2103-ay2223s2.github.io/website/schedule/week2/project.html

Users cannot delete any task after they are given to Duke.

This is an issue to the user as the task list becomes too big and
cumbersome to read. Furthermore, any erronous tasks added cannot be
changed or deleted.

Hence, I replaced the Task[] array with an ArrayList<Task> collection.
Then, I created the deleteTask method that deletes a task using the
ArrayList methods.

This will resolve the current issue and also keep the ordering of the
tasks. Using collections also makes deleting withou errors much easier.
